alert.note: Alert for Southwest Wyoming (Wyoming) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 27 at 4:51PM MDT by NWS Saltlake
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of central Uinta County through 530 PM MDT... At 450 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Lyman, or 22 miles southwest of Granger, moving northeast at 20 mph. Additional strong thunderstorms with microburst potential extend eastward to Evanston. HAZARD...Wind gusts of 50 to 55 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Evanston, Lyman, Mountain View, Ragen, Millburne, Church Buttes, Fort Bridger, Altamont, Piedmont, Carter and Leroy. This includes Interstate 80 in Wyoming between mile markers 6 and 56. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...55 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
